title: Liverpool news: Jurgen Klopp issues warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 11:25 pm Liverpool have lost further ground in the top-four race. (Getty Images) 
Jurgen Klopp has warned his Liverpool players that they are playing for their futures after the 3-1 defeat to Leicester City on Monday evening. 
Liverpool conceded further ground in the race for a top-four place as Jamie Vardy’s double and Danny Drinkwater’s sublime strike sealed a deserved win for the Premier League champions. 
The defeat has left Klopp’s side fifth in the table, and they will be overtaken if Manchester United register a win over Bournemouth in Saturday’s early kick-off. 
‘I’m not worried,’ said Klopp. Vardy struck twice to sink Liverpool. (AMA/Getty Images) 
‘I probably should be but we have a week to prepare for next game [against Arsenal]. 
‘We are all playing for our future here.
